title: Perception and Its Distortions
content: We don't perceive reality directly—we construct it through filtering and interpretation. Expectations influence what we see. We miss what we don't expect. We see patterns in noise. Understanding perceptual limitations enables compensation through verification and multiple perspectives.

mcq.question: You expect to see a normal reading on an instrument. The reading is abnormal but you report it as normal. What happened?

options.B: Expectation influenced perception—you saw what you expected

mcq.explanation: Expectation powerfully shapes perception. We literally see what we expect, especially in quick glances. This is why cross-checks and deliberate verification exist—to catch expectation-driven misperception.

openQuestions: When has expectation caused you to miss something?
How do you verify perceptions against expectations?
